pr_title: DHFPROD-4656: Added models service and controller

timeline.message:
DHFPROD-4656: Added models service and controller

Much of this is updates to existing tests and test plumbing:

- Also added more reliable way of waiting for post-commit triggers to finish - waitForTasksToFinish. This required a new privilege to be added to data-hub-developer in the test app. 
- Tweaked test logging in both core and one-ui so it's not so verbose 
- The Load*Command objects are no longer autowired in HubTestBase - they're just manually constructed when needed now
- Marked EnvironmentControllerInstallTest as a "destructive" test, and added a test suite that runs all one-ui tests except for destructive tests

timeline.body:
I'm guessing we are using the guard condition in this case since we are performing string concatenation.
No need to change right now but the following approach would allow us to get rid of the "if" block.
Since we are using slf4j we can get rid of the guard condition by using 
```suggestion
                logger.debug("Getting file: {}",  srcFile);
```
This gets rid of the superfluous string concatenation when the logger is disabled for DEBUG level.
timeline.bodyText:
I'm guessing we are using the guard condition in this case since we are performing string concatenation.
No need to change right now but the following approach would allow us to get rid of the "if" block.
Since we are using slf4j we can get rid of the guard condition by using
  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            logger.debug("Getting file: " + srcFile);
          
          
            
                            logger.debug("Getting file: {}",  srcFile);
          
      
    
    
  

This gets rid of the superfluous string concatenation when the logger is disabled for DEBUG level.
timeline.bodyHTML:
I'm guessing we are using the guard condition in this case since we are performing string concatenation.
No need to change right now but the following approach would allow us to get rid of the "if" block.
Since we are using slf4j we can get rid of the guard condition by using

Suggested change
logger.debug("Getting file: " + srcFile);
logger.debug("Getting file: {}", srcFile);

This gets rid of the superfluous string concatenation when the logger is disabled for DEBUG level.
timeline.author: akshaysonvane

replies.bodyText: There are a lot of little things like that to clean up - I'm just changing the logging from info to debug here, since the info logging was cluttering up logging in a test. And this doesn't seem like it warrants "info" level.
replies.author: rjrudin
